result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
9:32 AM Defendant Brian M Sakowski in court.  Attorney Abigail J. Broze in court for Brian M Sakowski.  Prosecuting attorney Jack A. Pitzo in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Parties have reached an agreement.  Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 
Case is dismissed and read in to 21CM972. Defendant consents to bail posted on dismissed and read in case 22CM944 to be applied to financial obligations on case 21CM972.

9:33 AM Defendant Brian M Sakowski in court.  Attorney Abigail J. Broze in court for Brian M Sakowski.  Prosecuting attorney Charles Patrick Hoffmann in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defense has received discovery and is waiting for a global offer.
Hearing scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 09:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Brian M Sakowski
Current: W527 S5110 Big Bend Rd, Waukesha, WI 53189   (Effective: 06-17-2021)
Prior: W237 S5110 Big Bend Rd, Waukesha, WI 53189
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.

records.addlTxt:
CONDITIONS:
Defendant has posted $150.00.
Defendant to have no VIOLENT contact with victim/witness/business listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.
Defendant is not to disseminate any information in the Victim Identification Key, with the exception of their attorney.

Case called at 9:32 AM
District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Brian M Sakowski in court with attorney Abigail Broze as friend of the Court.   
Defendant's sister appeared in court.
Attorney Broze indicates that she was court appointed on 21CM0972 and she will accept the court appoint her on this case also.
Attorney Broze indicates that she has received a copy of the Criminal Complaint, waives its reading, and enters a not guilty plea.
Court will leave the Cash Bail set at $150.00 which has already been posted.
Court will add the following conditions to the Cash Bail.
CONDITIONS:
Defendant to have no VIOLENT contact with victim/witness/business listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.
Defendant is not to disseminate any information in the Victim Identification Key, with the exception of their attorney.
Attorney Broze requests another hearing date to negotiate a global offer with the State.  Court grants. Defendant Brian M Sakowski in court with attorney Abigail J. Broze.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key signed by Judge Michael O. Bohren on 05/25/2022.
Victim/Witness Identification Key filed, under seal,  by the District Attorney's office.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
